detaileddescription.para: Audio routing node [input]: primary audio input
Audio routing node [output]: primary audio output
Audio routine node [input]: use another signal as the modulator source such as an fx_oscillator. The oscillator can be run though the clipper for example to create new types of waveforms.
Audio routing node [output]: just the pitch modulated signal without mixing in the original signal
Control routing node [input]: modulation rate in Hz
Control routing node [input]: clean signal mix
Control routing node [input]: delayed signal mix

memberdef.argsstring: (float rate_hz, float depth, float feedback, OSC_TYPES mod_type)
memberdef.name: fx_variable_delay

parameterdescription.para: The feedback from output to input (-1.0 -> 1.0)
The shape of the waveform used to modulate (e.g. OSC_SINE, OSC_TRI, etc.)

memberdef.argsstring: (float rate_hz, float depth, float feedback, float buf_size_ms, float mix_clean, float mix_delayed, OSC_TYPES mod_type, bool ext_mod)
memberdef.name: fx_variable_delay

parameterdescription.para: The feedback from output to input (-1.0 ->1.0)
The size of the audio in milliseconds (start wtih a value around 30)
The clean mix. If this is set to 0.0, then you'll just get the pitch changing aspect of the wave that can used for tape delay simulators, etc.
The shape of the waveform used to modulate (e.g. OSC_SINE, OSC_TRI, etc.)
whether to use an external modulation source (set to true or false)

memberdef.argsstring: (float rate_hz, float depth, float feedback, float buf_size_ms, float mix_clean, float mix_delayed, OSC_TYPES mod_type, bool ext_mod, float initial_phase)
memberdef.name: fx_variable_delay

parameterdescription.para: The feedback from output to input (-1.0 ->1.0)
The size of the audio in milliseconds (start wtih a value around 30)
The clean mix. If this is set to 0.0, then you'll just get the pitch changing aspect of the wave that can used for tape delay simulators, etc.
The shape of the waveform used to modulate (e.g. OSC_SINE, OSC_TRI, etc.)
whether to use an external modulation source (set to true or false)

briefdescription.para: Enable the this_effect (it is enabled by default)
Bypass the this_effect (will just pass clean audio through)
Updates the depth of the variable delay.
Updates the rate (Hz) of the variable delay.
Updates the feedback parameter of the variable delay.
Updates the clean mix of the variable delay.
Updates the delayed signal mix of the variable delay.
Sets the the type of oscillator used as the LFO.
Prints the parameters for this effect.
Effect: Variable delay - foundational block of flangers and choruses.

detaileddescription.para: The variable delay effect is the basis for a number of time-varying delay effects like chorus, flanger, phaser, vibrato, Leslie simulator, etc.
Here's a nice tutorial on how variable delays work in these various building blocks: https://www.dsprelated.com/freebooks/pasp/Time_Varying_Delay_Effects.html
